main event: A bright light, the size of a large aircraft, was observed hovering over Missile Site 7 at Altus Air Force Base in Oklahoma on May 21, 1964.
interesting points: The light was bright enough to illuminate the silo caps, hangar, and other structures at the missile site.
The object was observed by several witnesses, who confirmed its presence.
The object moved vertically in a northwest direction, rapidly gaining altitude until it disappeared from view.
The object was observed for approximately 10 minutes.
The incident was investigated as part of Project Blue Book, and the Dearborn Observatory at Northwestern University later identified the object as Echo II, a satellite.
sighted object: A bright, round, white light the size of a basketball
location: Altus Auxiliary Site Number 7, Altus Air Force Base, Oklahoma
witnesses: Several military personnel, including A3C Davis and A1C Sumera
